title: These Are The Last of Us Part 2 Remastered PC Launch Times For When You'll Be Able To Start Playing
text:
Summary
- The Last of Us Part 2 Remastered will launch on PC on April 3 with simultaneous global start times.
- Naughty Dog chose to develop Intergalactic: The Heretic Prophet over The Last of Us Online.
- PC and console versions will both receive updates, with the game also coming to Steam Deck.
PC players will soon be able to experience what many consider to be Naughty Dog's finest work to date, as The Last of Us Part 2 Remastered will be available on Steam and on the Epic Games Store starting tomorrow, April 3.
While pre-load of the game is live now, for those who are looking to play the game the moment it unlocks, we're here to help with our handy The Last of Us Part 2 release times list.
Related
 Former PlayStation Boss Shuhei Yoshida Played The Last of Us Online And Thought It "Was Great"
Naughty Dog opted to develop Intergalactic: The Heretic Prophet instead of The Last of Us Online.
Here's The Exact Time When You'll Be Able To Play The Last of Us Part 2 Remastered on PC
Here's a list of the times for when the game will be playable:
- Los Angeles: April 3, 2025, at 10 AM PT
- New York: April 3, 2025, at 1 PM ET
- London: April 3, 2025, at 6 PM BST
- Rio de Janeiro: April 3, 2025, at 2 PM Brasilia Time
- Berlin: April 3, 2025, at 7 PM CEST
- Sydney: April 4, 2025, at 4 AM AEDT
- Tokyo: April 4, 2025, at 2 AM JST
- Auckland: April 4, 2025, at 6 AM NZDT
These times all line up for one simultaneous start time, which isn't the case with how digital games launch on consoles. For better or worse, everyone will be starting The Last of Us Part 2 Remastered simultaneously on PC.
Without diving into spoilers,The Last of Us Part 2 Remastered's story is one of its best-selling points, so if you haven't played the first game, it's probably better to start with that before diving into this one.
Related
 Sony Backs Down On PSN Requirement For The Last Of Us 2, Spider-Man 2 And More
Is this it, or are more games getting the same treatment?
Aside from dropping the PlayStation Network requirement in order to play the game on PC, Sony is also adding a few extras to the PC launch of TLOU2 Remastered on PC. Thankfully, console owners won't be left out, as they're also getting a game update tomorrow to add in new trophies and more.
If you're wondering if the game is worth the purchase price, read our review where we state, "In a lot of ways, The Last of Us Part II will make you angry, it will upset you, and it will break your heart as much as its glimpses of warmth and humanity will lift your spirits." The game is also Steam Deck verified, so if you plan on playing it on your portable device, it should work without a hitch.
Aside from the game's launch and a new patch for console owners, Season 2 of HBO's The Last of Us TV show is premiering this month. While we don't know how many seasons the show will run, the showrunners assure people that they won't go the Game of Thrones route, which is comforting to hear.

In a recent discussion, Neil Druckmann, the creator of The Last Of Us, described the project's rocky start and its success at Naughty Dog.
